Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2008 01:11AM KnitWit wrote: I have a lump that is most likely benign....and the only reason I am taking care of it NOW is because I was told it would most likely GROW and the scar to get rid of it would be bigger!   So...I would tell her that benign lumps grow and need to gotten rid of before they stretch out the breast tissue.  It would work for ME and I am 48 and have nursed 4 children a total of 10 years!!!  Since my lumps are not too big yet, they can be gotten rid of with a mammotome which requires only one needle to vacuum out the tissue. -Karen in Napa, CA
Posts.Title: How do i talk to my girlfriend janined86 janined86

Posts.Content: KnitWit wrote: Okay... have three lumps....smoothed edged and regular...like bubbles.  Doc is certain they are benign but says they need to be removed.  One is in the nipple area, and the other two are right under the nipple.  One is about an inch, the other 1/2 and the other 2 inches.  That just seems like a lot of tissue to me!  How will this affect my appearence?  My kids say that I am older (48!) and no one looks at my breast anyway so why do I care.  You will be glad to know I haven't slapped my kids for this!  I know they think I am so old that it couldn't POSSIBLY matter...but sheesh!  I like being even.  I do!  Any thoughts?  -Karen in Napa, CA Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy...cosmetic questions? KnitWit ravdeb

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2008 04:28AM KnitWit wrote: It IS vexing to keep hearing how DENSE your breasts are during mammograms!  What are you supposed to do about it?  I got frustrated with my town's breast resources and heard about NIH approved "Cancer Centers" (I don't seem to be able to post the link for you but look up "NCI-designated Cancer Centers") which might offer better care.  I got an appointment at UCSF's breast center for a week after I am supposed to have a few of the lumps removed.  I am not sure if I will cancel it yet or not.  The surgeon here doing the mammotome has alot of experience in the proceedure whereas I will probably get a resident at UCSF!  -Karen
